options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100"><polygon points="50,15 85,35 85,65 50,85 15,65 15,35" fill="none" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="35" cy="40" r="5" fill="black"/><circle cx="65" cy="40" r="5" fill="black"/><circle cx="35" cy="60" r="5" fill="black"/><circle cx="65" cy="60" r="5" fill="black"/><circle cx="50" cy="30" r="5" fill="black"/><circle cx="50" cy="70" r="5" fill="black"/></svg>

options.label: E
options.svg: <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100"><polygon points="50,15 78,30 85,60 65,85 35,85 15,60 22,30" fill="none" stroke="black" stroke-width="2"/><circle cx="50" cy="30" r="4" fill="black"/><circle cx="68" cy="42" r="4" fill="black"/><circle cx="68" cy="68" r="4" fill="black"/><circle cx="50" cy="80" r="4" fill="black"/><circle cx="32" cy="68" r="4" fill="black"/><circle cx="32" cy="42" r="4" fill="black"/><circle cx="50" cy="55" r="4" fill="black"/></svg>

explanation: The rule is that the number of small black circles inside the large shape is equal to the number of sides of the large shape. Figure A has a triangle (3 sides) and 3 circles. Figure B has a square (4 sides) and 4 circles. Figure D has a hexagon (6 sides) and 6 circles. Figure E has a heptagon (7 sides) and 7 circles. Figure C is the odd one out because it has a pentagon (5 sides) but only contains 4 circles.
